item.title: Where Generations Come Home
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Date and Time: Friday, March 25th 4pm -6pm Location: Dr. George W. Davis Senior Center ( Court Yard) Attendance: Free event but you must RSVP to: william.rhodes@bhpmss.org no later than [...]
item.content:encoded:
Date and Time: Friday, March 25th 4pm -6pm

Location: Dr. George W. Davis Senior Center ( Court Yard)

Attendance: Free event but you must RSVP to: william.rhodes@bhpmss.org no later than 3/18/22  ( We only have 40 guest spaces available). 

Requirements: You must show proof of vaccination to attend the event.

Project Partners: This project is a collaboration between. The Intergenerational Program at Bayview Senior Services, SF Urban Film Fest, Studios of Key West and the Bahama Village Music Program.

Details: There will be live music performance by Lorerrta Gooden who is a Dr. GWD resident. There will be several short films shown and refreshments will be served. The event will conclude with a panel discussion between artist William Rhodes and Kawana Staffney -Ashe who is the Executive Director of the Bahama Village Music Program in Key West, FL. Both panelists will talk and answer questions about how the arts and Intergenerational exchange can preserve a community suffering from gentrification and displacement.

item.title: Black Cuisine 2022
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: THANK YOU We thank you for supporting our seniors and making Black Cuisine 2021 Successful Yet Again! Soul food was born out of struggle and survival [...]
item.content:encoded:
THANK YOU

We thank you for supporting our seniors and making Black Cuisine 2021 Successful Yet Again!

Soul food was born out of struggle and survival within the African American community.  

Although the African American community is one of the hardest hit during this pandemic, enduring almost every challenge and loss imaginable, we have continued to overcome time and time again.

Bayview Senior Services remains a pillar in the community that consistently provides nourishment for our communities’ body and soul. Black Cuisine is deeply rooted in coming together to tell the stories of triumph from generation to generation by celebrating African American culture and heritage.

Your participation in Black Cuisine makes an important contribution to our work with Seniors. 

41 years of Black Cuisine: Food is Love. Black Cuisine is a delicious fundraiser for Bayview Senior Services.   It was founded by the late DR. GEORGE W. DAVIS  in 1979, highlighting the best of soul food and African American culture. What started out as a soul food cooking contest amongst seniors to educate youth about their rich African American history,  evolved into the longest standing festival in Bayview Hunters Point. The festival attracts thousands  with its food booths, vendors, live entertainment and other activities.

Black Cuisine 2020 was cancelled at the recommendation from San Franciscoâ€™s Department of Public health to cancel large non-essential events due to COVID-19. While the in person gathering was called off, meals were offered on a take out basis – thus the spirit of Black Cuisine prevailed.

Black Cuisine 2020 Media feature – https://www.ktvu.com/video/662323

item.title: Adult Day Health Center
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Reassurance for caregivers to have a safe place for their loved ones, empowering participants to engage in their healthcare and lifting up the spirits of those who are isolated and homebound.
item.content:encoded:
Reassurance for caregivers to have a safe place for their loved ones, empowering participants to engage in their healthcare and lifting up the spirits of those who are isolated and homebound

Bayview Hunters PointÂ Adult Day HealthÂ serves as an extension of care, love, and support to families caring for their loved ones at home.It lifts up the spirits of those who would otherwise be isolated and homebound and it empowers elders and adults living with disabilities and chronic illnesses to stay engaged and remain active members in their community.

Adult Day HealthÂ provides:
  • Personal Care Assistance
  • Registered Nurse Assistance
  • Social Work Services
  • Physical Therapy
  • Occupational Therapy
  • Speech Therapy
  • Recreational Activities
  • Nutritious Meals and Nutrition Counseling
  • Psychological Counseling
  • Paratransit Transportation
The Program includes:
  • Dance Parties
  • Dance Competitions
  • Wii Sport Game Competitions
  • Wii Fit Exercise
  • Peer, Family and Caregivers’ Support Groups
  • Arts and Crafts
  • Musical Entertainment
  • Movie Days
  • Birthday and Holiday Celebrations

To become a member of our Adult Day Health Family, please contact :

Raenika Butler, Program Director
raenika.butler@bhpmss.org
415-826-4774
1250 Lasalle Ave.
San Francisco, CA 94124

BHPMSS’ Adult Day Health Center is licensed
by the Department of Health Services
